Reviews.Content: Excellent Atmosphere. It started off excellent because we got a free upgrade to Deluxe as opposed to what we booked, which was Superior.We got greeted very well by the staff and the taxi ride from the airport was about 10 minutes away. Security was tight, which assured us.We got our welcome drink but never got our 'complimentary gift hamper'.Our room was just nice, the room opened up to a nice cosy swimming pool and it was very clean. The housekeeping staff did well to preserve the room and it seemed like everyday was our first day checking in.The distance was not too far away from the airport and not too far from the city. Which was a good thing. It was quiet and cosy.The hotel restaurant highly recommends their bbq beef and pork ribs. So do I.Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and we will definitely recommend it to anyone that wishes to go.
Reviews.Author: noriz69

Reviews.Content: The best hotel! I stayed at the Vira in mid 2005 and then again in late 2007. It truly is the best hotel I've stayed at - the rooms are spacious and the sounds of the busy city are completely hidden by the layout of the hotel. Each time, we were greeted with a welcome fruit juice on arrival and the staff remembered us from a stay two years previously! The pool is beautiful and clear, surrounded by a lush garden. The Vira is perfect for a relaxing stay - it is not in the center of Kuta, rather it is about a 5 minute walk away, but it makes all the difference - you can't hear the traffic at all.The service is immaculate - each time we went outside, the security guards would actually clear the way on the street for us to walk across the road (the traffic is very busy). The gardener actually invited me to have dinner with his family. It was my last night, so I couldn't, but the thought was beautiful.For what you pay, you get so much more.
Reviews.Author: Ellen008

Reviews.Content: Nice quiet hotel in busy Kuta I've never stayed in Kuta area before. After experiencing 1 night in Kuta, I found that I prefer the quieter area like Sanur and Ubud. I stayed at The Vira hotel with my fiancee, in the superior room (room 308 at lvl 3). It was nice. New and simple. We liked the bed, cause it's very comfortable. It was not big, but enough (for Asian). Bathroom was surprisingly small but clean anyway. Verandah was super tiny. Breakfast was a spread, with delicious fish and chicken sausages, salad, chicken porridge, fried rice, fried noodle, and potato bolognaise. Too bad we had a morning flight to catch! There were restaurants nearby, but we did not have the time to try. There was a restaurant called Kunyit something with its authentic Balinese cuisine near the Santika Premiere, which seemed promising. We had some problems back then since the staff in the receptionist area told us that there wouldn't be any airport transfer (and now I know that it was actually included in the package that we paid for but the staff was not aware about it), but it was already settled. All in all, the Vira was good and it provided good service. I'd give it 7/10.
Reviews.Author: monastella

Reviews.Content: Fantastic! My partner and I stayed at the Vira Bali for 4 nights on the start of our trip around Indo. It is a very beautiful hotel, everything is extremely clean, it is luxurious! The pool is very nice too, and the breakfast are fabulous!! We enjoyed sitting out the front of the hotel watching the locals go by while we ate our buffet breakfast. The only issue is the distance from the center of Kuta, it is about a 20min perspiring walk, but it is much better to be out of the center as you really get sick of everything in there within a couple of days!
Reviews.Author: Tassie-Travellers64

Reviews.Content: Vira is tops My wife and I stayed at the Vira last October and it was brillant the staff are excellent and very friendly nothing a bother. It is a boutique hotel and offers the privacy and intamacy not normally found in a lot of the larger resorts it may only have a 3 star rating but believe me everything is certainly 5 star. HIGHLY RECCOMEND this hotel for couples wanting some intamcy. CHEERS AND THANKS HEAPS to all the staff at the Vira. Look forward to staying there again soon.
Reviews.Author: Brad100NSWAustralia

Reviews.Content: Disappointing Hotel is quite clean compared to some I have stayed in in SEAsia in the past. Daily breakfast okay, although the toaster is broken and there can be quite a delay in organising toast, such a simple thing can be fixed by purchasing a new toaster! Another problem with meals is that this hotel has no high chair which makes meals with small children quite difficult.When booking the hotel I was advised that I would have to organise a late check out directly with the hotel once I arrived, once I arrived and on several occasions thereafter I was advised that I could only ask for a late checkout on the morning of my last day. On the morning of my last day after an 11 night stay I was told I could not have the late checkout. Very disappointing, if I had have known this up front I would have stayed elsewhere. This hotel is also the noisiest I have ever stayed in, door slamming everywhere and the walls are paper thin, you hear everyone in the adjoining rooms talking, using the bathroom and their televisions.
Reviews.Author: shazzafromoz

Reviews.Content: Small, intimate  We booked the Vira thru an online discount site only 3 weeks prior to leaving and were a little worried but we didnt need to be. The hotel is only about 7 mins from airport and check-in was quick and easy. We were 3 solo women and wanted somewhere small and personal and the Vira suited us perfectly. We had the ground floor rooms and the pool was 10 steps from our door which I loved. Dont know if there is a view from the upper rooms , it is built around the central pool and has minimal gardens but what is there is lovely and beautifully maintained. My only complaint was that the pool was really cold but many love that, as a lot of guys I know dont like lukewarm swims so it is a personal thing. I thought it would be very noisy being so small n closed in but I heard no noise any nights but I guess that does depend on the clientelle at the time in any hotel. The gradens keep your room nice and private and upstairs rooms had lift accress and seem to have good size balconies. The rooms were large enough and very clean with king size, firm beds, good pillows and perfectly working A/C. In room safe worked fine, 2 water bottles provided free.The staff were efficient and honest, I often left jewellery about (nothing valuable) and it was always there on return. Breakfast was basic but a good enough variety that changed daily and if there was no bacon you could request some, eggs n pancake station, enough to fill you up. We had drinks around pool some afternoons during the happy hour and ate in rest one night which was just fine. The staff all over were lovely and friendly as you find most Bali folks are. The Vira is worth a return visit but not for kids... no where for them to run off to play.Fairly central easy walk or cheap n quick taxi ride into Kuta and security out front excellent at halting traffic and getting you a taxi. Certinally good value for your dollar.
Reviews.Author: debsclan

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel The Vira Bali is a wonderful Boutique hotel. We stayed there twice during our trip and initially we booked a suite room. This room was huge and had a seperate lounge room with a kitchen area. The bathroom was lovely and included a nice bath tub.The lounge room also included a DVD player which was great after a long day of shopping.We stayed in a superior room for the last two nights of our trip and although much smaller, very sufficient for 2 persons. The hotel is extrememly clean and in a great location on Jalan Kartika. It is about 5-8 mins walk past Waterbom Park on the left. There is a great Indo restaurant accross the road called Muddys Warung and also a Kodak Money Changer within 50m of the hotel. It was really handy.Breakfast was really good and the coffee was actually nice. Staff at the Vira were lovely and very professional. The pool was beautiful and absolutley sparkling.The Vira was a pleasant surprise and I would stay there again no problems at all.
Reviews.Author: dscottfl

Reviews.Content: A great place to stay! I stayed in this hotel for a week and very much enjoyed my experience. As a female travelling alone I felt very comfortable staying in this hotel. The staff were all very friendly and were always helpful. The room was great and lived up to my expecatations. I found the room very quiet and I had a great view of the pool from my balcony. A nice big bed too and the rooms were kept up to a high standard on a daily basis.The breakfast at the hotel was very good and varied. I also ate at the hotel restaurant a few evenings and it was very high quality, a good choice and again, very good service and beautiful surroundings.This hotel also offered free transfers to and from the airport which is also a bonus. Over all I would definatly reccommend this hotel and it is in a quiet location, although still close enough to all the hustle and bustle of Kuta.
Reviews.Author: MusicalM

Reviews.Content: Very friendly and clean A smaller more intiamate hotel where the staff remember who you are - couldn't fault it - very clean, all rooms were poolside and although it didn't have a swim up bar the staff could see if you needed anything as it was a nice sized area. Good breakfast with something for everyone, mainly European clientelle when we were there, good prices, free courtesy bus into Kuta Square. If you could have picked up the hotel and moved it to Seminyak which is more upmarket it would have fitted in perfectly. Ideal location if you are a Catholic wanting to go to church on sunday as it is right next to the Catholic Church. Couldn't fault the staff.
Reviews.Author: veepee

Reviews.Content: budget close to airport hotel They will pick up from airport and drop off (friendly  efficient), its just a few minutes drive. We stayed one night before heading north. We found it noisy (walls thin and anyone above you seems to be in the same room). Nice pool area, buffet breakfast was good. We paid $75 thro Expedia but there are similar room at other hotels at $50. Little walk to shops. Not really a place for a week in our view
Reviews.Author: nzbased

Reviews.Content: Excellent location.....value for money !       Hotel entrance
Reviews.Author: jtham

Reviews.Content: Great value and a high class place Spent four nights here, very nice hotel, clean, has a great pool surrounded by a cool fountain and a lush tropical garden. The in house spa had very reasonable prices and good treatments/packages. Staff was helpful in getting my laundry finished late in the day. This has to be one of the best value hotels in the area, its slightly further out of Kuta but still walking distance to it, its very close to the airport and the complimentary airport pick up is very good. After travelling to the northern part of Bali we came back to this hotel for one night before flying out. The front desk/guard staff were very helpful in organizing hired cars to any location. Breakfasts had plenty of variety (omlettes, waffles, fruit, pastried, rice, bacon, cereals etc.) and went till 11 am.
Reviews.Author: eebtravel

Reviews.Content: clean and good location       not so many toiletries, but clean
Reviews.Author: minimili

Reviews.Content: NIce Place Stayed here in mid-October. When we arrived I was upgraded at no extra charge to a Suite Room (which was the only suite room with both a balcony and a large veranda. The Room was clean, and had a seperate living room with large fridge, large color TV (with the BEST cable channels anywhere I have found in ASIA) with a DVD player (which is great for all of the cheap DVD's you will find in Bali), a large coach, table and four chairs. The seperate bedroom had a large comfortable King bed, TV, dresser, two end tables and a small fridge. The bathroom was good sized. Bottled water was provided everyday. Make sure you use it for everything, including rinsing your toothbrush. The only unusual thing was that the only closet was located in the bathroom.The staff are the most friendly that I have ever met, and they always offer a smile and are most helpful. The free shuttle service to Kuta Beach was great, where they drop you is also right near the main shopping area. They will also shuttle you back to the airport at no charge (just a tip) when you depart. Airport is about 5-10 minute ride away.Location of hotel is good, within walking distance of all the restaurants and local attractions, but WATCH YOUR STEP ON THE SIDEWALKS - huge holes and missing sewer/electrical covers and very dark at night.. Only down side was the daily buffet breakfast. Little variety, and same stuff three days in a row.I was lucky to stay here, not a bad place, but next time I go to Bali I will try the Santika Beach Resort. But you can't go wrong at Vira Bali Hotel either.
Reviews.Author: FDNYCAPT

Reviews.Content: Nice, new and clean hotel       The Pool
Reviews.Author: sTeMiNt

Reviews.Content: Good value Boutique Hotel We stayed at this Hotel as we were unable to book into our first choice until the next day.The Vira is a nice Boutique Hotel,with a number of small trading shops nearby.We were pleased to be upgraded on arrival as our room was unavailable,this was done without fuss.The front desk were very courteous and helpful.Our room overlooked the pool which at most times appeared empty.We were happy with the breakfast supplied and felt relaxed throughout our stay.The only down side may be that the pool area lacked a lot of sunny spots,but other than that, a nice place at a nice price.
Reviews.Author: RMDJakarta

Reviews.Content: Nice, Clean Hotel a walk away from the action I booked a 3 nite/4 day package thru Air Asia and chose accomodation at the Vira Bali Hotel. The hotel is very nicely set up with a pretty pool in the centre court yard. My room was big and clean with a small balcony overlooking the pool. The reception and halls ways were nicely decorated in a subdued Balinese style. The staff were extremely helpful at all times and I took advantage of their free shuttle service into the centre of Kuta several times. They also provide free transport to/from the airport. The only minus about this hotel was the breakfast buffet which was included in my package. It was OK but not great although I was able to find something to eat each morning.
Reviews.Author: FigPow

Reviews.Content: We had a great time We really enjoyed our time at the Vira Bali. I notified them that it was our honeymoon and they upgraded our room for free and gave us a free and very tasty cake. The location isn't great as it is a little far from the action and the beach but there was usually a driver on hand to drive you about for free. Best of all..... it was quiet (very rare in this part of town). Excellent value.
Reviews.Author: bigboroboy

Reviews.Content: Just ok Vira Bali is tucked at a far corner of the Kartika Plaza Road. This is a small property with small, but clean rooms and a proportionally small swimming pool. Nothing wrong with the hotel, but it odes have an overall claustrophobic feeling about it. Be it the corridors, the lobby or the rooms. But at the price (around $60) its a decent bet.Its not too far from Kuta beach, a 10 min walk, but commuting at night suggested by taxi if you dont want to be pestered by blokes peddling 'ladies in sanur' :)A big mall is pretty close by as are many places to eat. Even the hotel's own restaurant is ok for breakfast and a quiet dinner. Staff is efficient, but didnt find the front desk guys too friendly.Bottomline - okish place to stay, even with family, but if getting a better location / more open hotel, take it.
Reviews.Author: Amberish

Reviews.Content: Lovely, quiet and romantic stay We stayed in a Deluxe room at The Vira Bali for 5 nights in May 2007. On arrival at 11pm on the first night, we requested for a room-change as the one we were given had its pool view entirely blocked by a tree. The front desk staff were very polite and accomodating 鈥?we were given a new room on a higher floor within 20 minutes. The room was spacious, clean and nicely appointed. The bed was big and comfortable and the TV had many, many satellite channels. However, the pillows were flat but you could always call to ask for more. There were also some ants in the bathroom below the sink but otherwise it was very clean. The hotel is located at the south of Kuta and free shuttle is provided round the clock to Kuta Square but not any further. A cab ride back would cost approximately 20,000 rupiah. There is a 24-hour mini mart 100m down the left of the hotel as well as a bar and cafe 150m down the right. A lovely and afforable spa is just round the corner (Febri's). The restaurant staff were very friendly but breakfast was average 鈥?we wished there was more variety. The pool was small but very clean and nice, with a water feature at the side. However, it was mostly covered in shade throughout the day. There weren't many people staying at the hotel, which was a good thing for us as we enjoyed the tranquility. Overall, we had a pleasant stay here and we were very pleased with the hotel's service. We recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a cosy boutique hotel near Kuta Centre, yet away from all the noise and action.
Reviews.Author: dys

Reviews.Content: New hotel, great rooms, friendly staff       Spacious beds
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch

Reviews.Content: Very Nice A lovely boutique hotel with exceptionally friendly (and patient!) staff who go out of their way to make you feel at home and keep you happy. As long as you're quiet, this hotel has no problem with you taking a midnight dip in the beautiful pool (unlike most other places which make you get out of the pool far too early!). There's a catholic church next door which is nice to look upon, and this hotel is very close to all the action of Kuta (but not IN the action, which is good!). Discovery Mall is less than 10 mins walk - we went there 10 times in 7 days, it rocks!Breakfast is great value - I recommend having that included in your package. The only real gripe (apart from about some of the guests!) was that we stayed in a 4th floor (top floor) room and on a windy night there's no way anyone could sleep through the noise of the wind through the roof. We were moved to a suite which was much better, and I think they were fixing the roof. Apart from that, everything was beautiful and I would certainly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: lovecat

Reviews.Content: Highly Recommended! My husband and I stayed at the Vira Bali for 4 days in February. The staff was VERY ACCOMMODATING and FRIENDLY! On the day that we left, our flight was in the evening. So they let us check out of our room at a later time. And we hung out by the pool, until it was time to leave. They arranged for a shuttle to take us to the airport - on the way to the airport, we wanted to pack some local food to bring to the airport. Our driver took us to a great place and waited for us patiently in the car.Overall, it's a great place to stay for a relaxing holiday!
Reviews.Author: SpaSeeker07

Reviews.Content: Friendly staff We stayed at the Vira Bali with another couple for a friend's wedding. The staff are very friendly, the hotel is clean, the food is lovely and the service is outstanding. The pool area is rather small, not like the big hotels but this was still nice and gave the hotel a more personal feel. Our room opened up onto the pool area and tropical garden which was lovely. We had a great time. It is a bit out of the way of Kuta, but taksi's are so cheap in Bali we didn't really care.
Reviews.Author: kitty_kat_perth

Reviews.Content: Go down the Road If you want to be in Kuta it is a good location, however the staff is extremely Green. During our (4) nights they were unable to provide a map of Bali and/or Kuta - a basic request.During our stay the place felt empty. Had a nice pool and the rooms were very clean and modern.Moved down the road to Febris - what a find! For $20USD cheaper this hotel has a very excellent Spa and is affiliated with (2) other hotels in the area. Also their restaurant is excellent value - you will struggle to drop $20USD on Tuna dishes and other seafood dinners.
Reviews.Author: canbermuda

Reviews.Content: What a find! We stayed at the Vira Bali for one night after a very long flight from the UK, before travelling on to Lombok for a week. The hotel picked us up from the airport at Denpasar ($10 charge) and drove us the short 10 minutes to this lovely hotel. Our teenagers had their own room and my husband and I were up graded to a suite. The hotel is very clean and beautifully decorated. The pool is lovely and the food tasty. The hotel photos are just as you will find it!The surrounding area was not really my scene - probably about 20 years too old for it - but we discovered a great shopping mall about ten minutes walk from the hotel (out of the hotel entrance, turn right and keep going along the main road - it's a big, cream coloured building on the left hand side with steps leading up to it).A perfect place to recover from the long, long, long flight! (Note to self - Brunei is a 'dry' country so should have expected the Royal Brunei flight to be 'dry' too! The wonders of hindsight!)
Reviews.Author: tania_65

Reviews.Content: 鎵嬨仈銈嶃仾銉涖儐銉仹銇欍€?#x201d;   showReview(20753312, 'full');
